Reasoning: **Current Assessment and Decision**

Okay, here's the situation. I'm in round 13, facing a big blind of 30,000 chips, and I only have $23 to my name. I have a Flush strategy with a level 8 Flush (140 base chips, 18 mult). I've got 4/5 Diamonds already (Ace, 8, 5, 3), and with 13 Diamonds remaining in the 40-card deck, the odds are in my favor.

I have some powerful Jokers in play: Odd Todd gives me +31 chips for each odd-rank card, Abstract Joker has +18 Mult per Joker, To the Moon gives +10 Mult (Holo), The Tribe doubles the multiplier on a Flush, and Acrobat triples the mult on the *final* hand of the round. My goal is to hit that 30,000 chip requirement.

My current hand contains the 10 of Spades, 8 of Spades, King of Clubs (a Bonus card, but not a diamond), Ace of Diamonds, 8 of Diamonds, 5 of Diamonds, and 3 of Diamonds. The non-diamonds are clearly dead weight. I'm going to discard the 10 of Spades, 8 of Spades, and the King of Clubs (cards 1, 2, and 3). This gives me the best chance of getting that fifth Diamond and completing the Flush.

The probability of drawing at least one diamond from my three discards is pretty good, around 70%. If I hit the Flush, I'm looking at a decent chip yield: around 298 * 92 (Factoring in all the jokers = 27,416), which should be enough (although the Acrobat joker would have a bigger impact if this was the last round). This gives me the best odds to make a lot of chips and hit the goal of 30,000 chips. I need to get started with the discards.

[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 123]
Reasoning: **Analysis of the Current Balatro Scenario**

Okay, here's the situation: round 13, big blind at 6/8. Target's 30,000 chips. I have $23 and 4 hands left with 2 discards available. Chip count is at 0. Let's see what I have to work with. I'm dealt the 2 of Clubs, Ace of Diamonds (+11 chips), Queen of Diamonds (+10 chips), 8 of Diamonds (+8 chips), 7 of Diamonds (+7 chips), 5 of Diamonds (+5 chips), and 3 of Diamonds (+3 chips).

Wait a minute, I have six diamonds! Ace, Queen, 8, 7, 5, 3. I can *definitely* play a Flush. Now, let's see which Jokers I have in play: Odd Todd (+31 chips for odd ranks, A, 9, 7, 5, 3), Abstract Joker (+18 Mult), To the Moon (Holo: +10 Mult), Gift Card (irrelevant), The Tribe (x2 Mult for Flush), and Acrobat (x3 Mult on the final hand).

Okay, so I can play a Flush. That hand gives me a base of 140 chips and 18 Mult. I'm going to choose the Ace, Queen, 7, 5, and 3 of Diamonds because the odd cards will trigger Odd Todd. Let's see... Ace, 7, 5, and 3 are odd. The Queen is my fifth card.

Now I look at card chip values. Ace (11), Queen (10), 7 (7), 5 (5), 3 (3). Odd Todd gives a bonus of +31 chips for each of the four odd cards: 11+10+7+5+3 = 36 + (4 * 31) = 36 + 124 = 160. This is the math I am going to use. I calculate Total Chips: 140 base + 36 + 124 = 300 chips. Now, for the Mult: 18 base + 18 (Abstract) + 10 (To the Moon) = 46. The Tribe doubles that for Flush, so 46 * 2 = 92 Mult.

The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
